title: 109_hr3988
content: The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" gives priority to businesses with a significant presence in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. Federal departments must award a minimum of 30% for prime contracts and 40% for subcontracting to small businesses for reconstruction efforts. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes businesses with a significant presence in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. Federal departments must allocate a minimum of 30% for prime contracts and 40% for subcontracting to small businesses for reconstruction efforts, ensuring compliance with subcontracting goals for small businesses. The head of each Federal department or agency must provide maximum opportunities for small businesses participation and submit a report within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress detailing opportunities for small businesses under the Act. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act purposes. SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No federal facility can be permanently moved from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. This prohibition will end after two years from the enactment of this Act. Reports are required for facilities temporarily relocated for over 6 months. The facility can be temporarily relocated from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. Additional reports on the status of the facility must be submitted every 6 months during the temporary relocation period. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small business concern" as a small business located in a Gulf hurricane-affected area as of August 28, 2005. It also defines "Gulf hurricane disaster" as an event caused by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita declared a major disaster by the President. Additionally, it defines "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" as a county or parish in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita. The term "small business concern" in this Act refers to a business as defined in the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act will be effective 10 days after its enactment.
